meanings.definition: Having a tendency to be selective or particular in making choices.
meanings.sent1: She is choosier than her sister when it comes to picking out clothes.
meanings.sent2: The choosier you are about your friends, the more likely you are to find true companionship.
meanings.sent3: Even the pickiest eater would be considered choosier than him!
meanings.sent4: Her eye for detail makes her the choosier candidate for the job.
meanings.sent5: Being choosier about the ingredients will result in a tastier dish.

meanings.definition: Comparatively selective or particular in making choices.
meanings.sent1: Out of the two options, she was the choosier one.
meanings.sent2: As we grow older, we tend to become choosier about the company we keep.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be even choosier than the princess in the fairy tale!
meanings.sent4: His choosier taste in music led him to discover a new genre he loves.
meanings.sent5: The choosier you are with your words, the more impact they will have.
